long: Meaning: properly, to "bend" or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to "favor", "bestow"; causatively to "implore" (i.e. move to favor by petition).  Usage: beseech, × fair, (be, find, shew) favour(-able), be (deal, give, grant (gracious(-ly), intreat, (be) merciful, have (shew) mercy (on, upon), have pity upon, pray, make supplication, × very.  Source: a primitive root (compare "H2583");
